Key Arguments: The government or any entity should not have the power to decide what constitutes misinformation.
History has shown that alternative opinions initially deemed untrue can later be proven correct.
The legislation could infringe on Australians' freedom of speech.
Australians should have the right to form and express their own opinions without government interference.
Main Themes: Historical perspective on truth and misinformation
Notable Quotes: Do not stop Australians from having an opinion.
Australians need our freedom of speech.
We are not a dictatorship state so stop this bill from proceeding.
